Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using Flask in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Python class that implements a web server using Flask framework with authentication, search functionality, and WebSocket support. The server should handle HTTP requests, manage user sessions, and provide search capabilities against a data model.

Class Description: MalcomWeb is a Process subclass that implements a web server with Flask. It handles HTTP requests, manages authentication, provides search functionality against a data model, and supports WebSocket connections. The server can be configured through a setup dictionary and runs in its own process.

Attributes:

listen_port: [int] - The port number on which the server listens
listen_interface: [str] - The network interface on which the server listens
setup: [dict] - Configuration dictionary for server settings
http_server: [WSGIServer] - Instance of the WSGI server
app: [Flask] - Flask application instance

Methods:

__init__: [Name](auth, listen_port, listen_interface, setup) -> [None] - Initializes the web server process with authentication settings, port, interface, and configuration
run: [Name]() -> [None] - Starts the server process (inherited from Process)
stop_server: [Name]() -> [None] - Stops the server (currently just a placeholder)
start_server: [Name]() -> [None] - Configures and starts the Flask application with routes and WebSocket support
index: [Name]() -> [Response] - Route handler for the root URL (requires login)
search: [Name](term="") -> [Response] - Route handler for search functionality (requires login), processes both GET and POST requests
